title: Quickcast/Normal Cast?
body: Hi, I was just wondering, When i first played league i would say like after and a bit later lvl 30, i had the ability to use quickcast on but if i click on q for example lux, i get to see where here binding hits like the range of it and can control where it goes even tho im in quickcast? But now i have no access to this. Was this removed? Or i just cant find the setting? thanks.

replies.body:
You're looking for *Quick Cast with* ***indicators***. This feature has exactly what you're looking to get out of it and can be found in-game. I personally use it and can't think of a more enjoyable way to play League. ^.^

I hope that helped. Let me know if you have any questions.

I have a question about quick cast with indicators. 
How am I supposed to use it with abilities like Lux E, Anivia Q, and Aurelion Sol Q? It just shows the range indicator instead of detonating spells in mid-air. That's the only reason I don't use it.

I'm not sure I understand the issue that Quickcast w/ Indicators has with those abilities. Knowing the range is a really good way to judge whether you should use that ability and the rest is all up your judgment on when to pop the button again to detonate it.

Pressing the button again doesn't pop the ability. It'll make the ability detonate when it lands where you pointed, but you can't detonate in midair. At least, this is the case with Lux E. I haven't specifically tried the rest.

EDIT: Anivia and Aurelion Sol working as intended. Seems like just Lux with this problem, and obviously that's still enough that I can't use it since she's my highest mastery champ. Probably something to do with the fact that her E isn't considered a line skillshot? I don't know. Still, literally unplayable.

I just checked to confirm with my game team that you aren't supposed to be able to detonate Lux's E midair. You are only able to detonate it early only after it has landed at its max range. 

I hope this clarified the confusion around this ability.
Are there currently any bugs involving quickcast? Since the patch, I have been unable to use it. Even with it on, it just doesn't work.

You may have some messed up game configurations. You can reset them by deleting the **Config** folder inside the game directory (C:\Riot Games\League of Legends) while logged into the game. Then you can hop into a custom match to confirm the changes and set up *Quickcast with indicators* again.

Let me know if this helped!

Thank you, I managed to fix it and now quickcast is working as I like it.
...you're absolutely right. I know when I was playing her in season 5 it was just showing the range indicator instead of causing the early detonation, but that's clearly been fixed at some point.
You can hop into your in-game settings under *Hotkeys* and enable *Quickcast with indicators*. Let me know if this worked for you!
quick question. Doesn't this slow down casting of your abilities? it seemed like it used to but i haven't used it in 5 years.
I don't personally feel like it does, but I primarily play supports such as Leona, Taric and Nami. I may not be the best player to ask about limiting factors of this casting style. :P
Teach me how to Taric. Idk what I'm doing with him.

Technically, if you start from the same position, yes it does slow down casting a tiny bit: your spell is fired when you release the button instead of when you press it.

But in practice, you just don't start from the same position: you just begin pressing your button in advance, and when you want to actually fire it, you simply release, it's only half a movement, just as quickcast with no indicator is also half a movement (simple press, instead of simple release). Maybe you still feel a difference for very fast-paced combo champs, but in most cases, you just don't press your buttons with the same timings, but you actually fire your spells just as fast.

The main problem is that there is a huge habit and muscle memory factor. I'm used to pressing my buttons early and get ready to release them, so when I try to play with no indicators, I'm just firing my spells in the air too early.

No it doesn't, you can double tap your abilities to fire at the same speed but basically most pro player's use it because they've gotten used to it and it feels the same+increases accuracy on certain abilities. 

I for example cannot use Orianna Q with quick cast with indicator.
